basic.title: Primary Objective
basic.description: What is the primary purpose of email testing?

options.text: To increase email open rates with subscribers
options.outcome: This relates to marketing metrics, not email testing

options.text: To verify email functionality and appearance
options.outcome: Correct! This is the purpose of email testing.

options.text: To check if emails reach spam folders
options.outcome: While spam prevention is a benefit, it's not the primary purpose.

options.text: To test different subject lines for marketing effectiveness
options.outcome: The subject line is just one small component of an email.

basic.title: Email Clients
basic.description: Which email clients are typically included in testing scope?

options.text: Gmail and Outlook should be the main focus
options.outcome: While these are important clients, the scope should be broader.

options.text: Gmail, Outlook, Yahoo Mail, and Apple Mail
options.outcome: Correct! These are the main email clients, however, stakeholders may request additional email clients.

options.text: All possible email clients globally should be tested
options.outcome: Testing all global email clients would be impractical and the main clients with any specific requests from the client should be tested.

options.text: Mobile only email clients on specific devices
options.outcome: Testing should not be limited to mobile clients unless specifically requested by the client.

basic.title: UTM Understanding
basic.description: What does UTM stand for in email testing?

options.text: Universal Testing Module
options.outcome: While it is a module for testing, "Universal" is incorrect

options.text: Unified Tracking Method
options.outcome: This is a made-up term.

options.text: Urchin Trace Module
options.outcome: This is a made-up term.

options.text: Urchin Tracking Module
options.outcome: Correct! This is the correct statement and it tracks the performance of a marketing campaign

basic.title: Dark Mode
basic.description: Where or when should you check dark mode rendering?

options.text: This should be carried out on mobile devices
options.outcome: Testing only mobile could miss desktop related issues.

options.text: This should be carried out on desktop clients
options.outcome: Testing only desktop could miss mobile related issues.

options.text: Across all supported email clients and envrionments
options.outcome: Correct! Dark mode should be tested across all supported platforms

options.text: This should be tested only when specifically requested
options.outcome: While client requests matter, dark mode testing is a standard practice

basic.title: Email Testing Process
basic.description: What is the first step in email testing?

options.text: Check all links within the email can be correctly actioned
options.outcome: Link checking should come later in the process after documentation has been analysed.

options.text: Familiarise yourself with project documentation
options.outcome: Correct! This should be the first step in the testing process as there could be areas stated as out of scope.

options.text: Make sure the test environments are set up for testing activities
options.outcome: While important, this comes after reviewing documentation

options.text: Create test accounts for testing different outcomes to test scenarios
options.outcome: This would not come before reviewing documentation as certain areas could be out of scope

intermediate.title: Bug Reporting
intermediate.description: What should you do when you discover a bug in one environment?

options.text: Immediately report it against the specific environment
options.outcome: While reporting is important, checking other environments for the issue first is more efficient.

options.text: Check if the issue exists across other environments
options.outcome: Correct! Other environments must be checked to determine if the issue is global.

options.text: Only report it if it affects functionality of any features relating to the email
options.outcome: All issues should be reported regardless of type

options.text: Wait for client confirmation on how to proceed
options.outcome: Client confirmation isn't needed to report bugs

intermediate.title: Test Script Reporting
intermediate.description: How should test results be marked in the test script?

options.text: Only pass or fail for the specific tests
options.outcome: While pass or fail is included, more detailed options should be available and stated.

options.text: Using the Result Key options against each test
options.outcome: Correct! This is the recommended way of reporting issues.

options.text: With detailed written descriptions
options.outcome: Written descriptions supplement but don't replace the Result Key

options.text: Only marking critical issues
options.outcome: All issues should be marked, not just critical ones

intermediate.title: Reviewing Images
intermediate.description: What should be checked regarding email images?

options.text: Image quality and resolution should be checked
options.outcome: While quality is important, other aspects must also be checked including alignment and image placement

options.text: Image placement, alignment, quality, label, and display in both light and dark modes
options.outcome: Correct! These are all necessary checks for images within emails.

options.text: Whether images load and display correctly
options.outcome: Other aspects of image testing are also required such placement

options.text: Image size and format should be checked
options.outcome: Size and format are aspects that should be checked. However, other areas are required for full test coverage

intermediate.title: Company Details Signatures
intermediate.description: How should company details be verified in emails?

options.text: These details can be checked against Wikipedia
options.outcome: Wikipedia isn't a reliable source for verification.

options.text: Details can be verified against the client's company website
options.outcome: While the website can help, target market specificity is key which can be obtained through client documentation

options.text: Match details to the target market (e.g., UK address for UK market)
options.outcome: Correct! Details should be checked against target markets

options.text: Use company information as related to any project correspondence
options.outcome: Company correspondence information may not be accurate as solutions providers could be working on behalf of a client

intermediate.title: Project Metrics
intermediate.description: What should be included in the project metrics after testing?

options.text: The number of bugs raised on the project
options.outcome: Bug count alone is insufficient, and other metrics should be included such as project progress and ticket resolutions.

options.text: Session totals, ticket resolution totals, and project burndown
options.outcome: Correct! All these metrics should be included unless otherwise specified.

options.text: Test completion percentage should be stated in the metrics report
options.outcome: While completion is tracked, more metrics are required including environment matrix and ticket status

options.text: All critical issues should be stated in the metrics report
options.outcome: All issues, not just critical ones should be tracked

advanced.title: Resource Calculator
advanced.description: How should the resource calculator be used in email testing?

options.text: This should be used for estimating total project time
options.outcome: While it helps with timing, it's more comprehensive and includes more adjustable testing activities.

options.text: To calculate exact testing hours needed to complete a project
options.outcome: This provides guidance rather than exact calculations relating to test hours.

options.text: For guided timeframe planning with adjustable fields for setup, copy check, link check, rendering check, and reporting
options.outcome: Correct! This is used for multiple adjustable testing activities

options.text: This is used for billing purposes in relation to time frame and resources
options.outcome: This is used for planning testing activities and not billing

advanced.title: Unsubscribe Links
advanced.description: What is the correct approach when handling unsubscribe links during testing?

options.text: Report all non-functioning unsubscribe links as critical bugs
options.outcome: These may not necessarily be bugs in the test environment and documentation should be referenced for scope.

options.text: Don't report unsubscribe link issues as test environments may not be set up to action this functionality
options.outcome: Any potential issues should still be documented appropriately or queried with the client. Unless already stated in client documentation.

options.text: Understand that unsubscribe links may error due to test distribution differences from the live environment
options.outcome: Correct! This is potentially expected behaviour in a test environment, as a live environment may not yet not be set up to support this functionality. These details should be provided by the client

options.text: Test unsubscribe functionality in production environments
options.outcome: While production testing may work, it's not the recommended approach as this could disrupt on going monitoring by the client in production

advanced.title: Text Wrap Evaluation
advanced.description: How should text wrapping issues be evaluated?

options.text: Test all text wrapping on supported mobile devices
options.outcome: While mobile testing is important, all devices need checking that are specified by the client.

options.text: Compare against design specifications for consistent text flow across all devices
options.outcome: Correct! Checking consistency with design across all platforms is recommended.

options.text: Check headings as these are generally where text wrapping issues occur
options.outcome: All text needs checking, not just headings as text wrapping issues can be found anywhere within the content

options.text: Minor wrapping differences can be left in favour of major issues
options.outcome: All wrapping issues should be reported regardless of the severity

advanced.title: Results Tables Within Scripts
advanced.description: When updating the Overall Results table, what must be considered?

options.text: Failed tests from the days test activities should be included
options.outcome: While failures are important, all results must be included.

options.text: Critical issues from the days test activities should be included
options.outcome: All issues, not just critical ones, should be included.

options.text: Passed tests from the days test activities should be included
options.outcome: Both passes and failures must be included

options.text: The entire range of tests including any newly added environments
options.outcome: Correct! All test ranges should be updated including updating formulas to include any new environments

advanced.title: Light & Dark Mode Testing Priority
advanced.description: How should light & dark mode testing be coordinated across devices?

options.text: System-level changes only need testing in relation to light & dark mode
options.outcome: Client-specific settings must also be tested.

options.text: Check each email client independently in relation to light & dark mode testing
options.outcome: While individual testing is needed, overall system settings must also be considered.

options.text: Coordinate system settings and individual app preferences, understanding that some clients follow system settings while others need manual configuration
options.outcome: Correct! The relationship between system and app-specific settings should be tested.

options.text: Use only default settings when testing light & dark mode
options.outcome: Testing default settings alone is insufficient and client or app specific settings should also be tested.
